name: PnPPowerShell
description: Can use PowerShell cmdlets inline or with a referenced script.
author: Sebastian Sch√ºtze
helpMarkDown: This task helps you to execute inline PowerShell or a referenced file with the already loaded PnP PowerShell module. Check the [official documentation](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/sharepoint/sharepoint-pnp/sharepoint-pnp-cmdlets?view=sharepoint-ps) on how to use the PowerShell cmdlets.

inputs.name: SharePointVersion
inputs.label: SharePoint Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: SharePoint version to witch the PnP xml should be deployed to.

inputs.name: FileOrInline
inputs.label: Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Type of the script: File Path or Inline Xml.

inputs.name: PnPPowerShellInline
inputs.label: Inline PnP PowerShell
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Allows you to specify PowerShell containing PnP PowerShell cmdlets.

Check the [official documentation](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/sharepoint/sharepoint-pnp/sharepoint-pnp-cmdlets?view=sharepoint-ps) for command that can be used.

inputs.name: PnPPowerShellFilePath
inputs.label: PnP PowerShell Path
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Path to the PowerShell file containing the PnP.

Check the [existing schema](https://github.com/SharePoint/PnP-Provisioning-Schema) for a well formatted PnP xml file.

inputs.name: PsArguments
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Arguments passed to the PowerShell script. Either ordinal parameters or named parameters.

inputs.name: errorActionPreference
inputs.label: ErrorActionPreference
inputs.helpMarkDown: Prepends the line `$ErrorActionPreference='VALUE'` at the top of your script.

inputs.name: failOnStderr
inputs.label: Fail on Standard Error
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this is true, this task will fail if any errors are written to the error pipeline, or if any data is written to the Standard Error stream. Otherwise the task will rely on the exit code to determine failure.

inputs.name: workingDirectory
inputs.label: Working Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Working directory where the script is run.
